english:
A / An

Put a or an before a person or thing.


You See

Is she teacher / a teacher?


You Write

Is she a teacher?
spanish:
A / An

Coloca a o an antes de una persona o cosa.


Ves

¿Es ella teacher / a teacher?


Escribes

¿Es ella a teacher?

english:
For, With, To

Use these words in different situations:


Things are for people.

People are with people.

People go to places.


Examples

It is for my mother.

I am with my friend.

I go to the park.


You See

She drives ___ work.


You Write

She drives to work.
spanish:
For, With, To

Usa estas palabras en diferentes situaciones:


Las cosas son for las personas.

Las personas están with otras personas.

Las personas van to lugares.


Ejemplos

Es for mi madre.

Estoy with mi amigo.

Voy to el parque.


You See

Ella conduce ___ trabajo.


You Write

Ella conduce to trabajo.

english:
A / An

Use an when the next word starts with a, e, i, o, or u.

Use a when the next word starts with any other letter.


You See

I am ___ adult.


You Write

I am an adult.



You See

I am ___ student.


You Write

I am a student.
spanish:
A / An

Usa an cuando la siguiente palabra comienza con a, e, i, o o u.

Usa a cuando la siguiente palabra comienza con cualquier otra letra.


Ves

Soy ___ adulto.


Escribes

Soy an adulto.



Ves

Soy ___ estudiante.


Escribes

Soy a estudiante.

english:
A / An

Use an when the next word starts with a, e, i, o, or u.
Use a when the next word starts with any other letter.


You See
I do not have ___ apple.


You Write
I do not have an apple.



You See
She does not have ___ pencil.


You Write
She does not have a pencil.
spanish:
A / An

Usa an cuando la siguiente palabra comienza con a, e, i, o o u.
Usa a cuando la siguiente palabra comienza con cualquier otra letra.


Ves
No tengo ___ manzana.


Escribe
No tengo an manzana.



Ves
Ella no tiene ___ lápiz.


Escribe
Ella no tiene a lápiz.

english:
A / An

Use an when the next word starts with a, e, i, o, or u.

Use a when the next word starts with any other letter.


You See

I am ___ adult.


You Write

I am an adult.



You See

I am ___ student.


You Write

I am a student.
spanish:
A / An

Usa an cuando la siguiente palabra comience con a, e, i, o, o u.

Usa a cuando la siguiente palabra comience con cualquier otra letra.


Ves

Soy ___ adulto.


Escribes

Soy an adulto.



Ves

Soy ___ estudiante.


Escribes

Soy a estudiante.

english:
Using a, an, and the

Use a or an before general things or things that have not been seen or talked about before.


Use the before specific things or things that have already been mentioned.


You See

I visited ___ Grand Canyon this summer.


You Write

I visited the Grand Canyon this summer.
spanish:
Uso de a, an y the

Usa a o an antes de cosas generales o cosas que no han sido vistas o mencionadas antes.


Usa the antes de cosas específicas o cosas que ya han sido mencionadas.


Ves

Visité ___ Grand Canyon este verano.


Escribes

Visité the Grand Canyon este verano.

english:
A / An

Use an when the next word starts with a, e, i, o, or u.
Use a when the next word starts with any other letter.


You See
I do not want ___ apple.


You Write
I do not want an apple.



You See
She does not want ___ pencil.


You Write
She does not want a pencil.
spanish:
A / An

Usa an cuando la siguiente palabra comience con a, e, i, o, o u.
Usa a cuando la siguiente palabra comience con cualquier otra letra.


Usted Ve
No quiero ___ manzana.


Usted Escribe
No quiero an manzana.



Usted Ve
Ella no quiere ___ lápiz.


Usted Escribe
Ella no quiere a lápiz.

english:
A / An

Use an when the next word starts with a, e, i, o, or u.


You See

I am a / an adult.


You Write

I am an adult.

Use a when the next word starts with any other letter.


You See

I am a / an student.


You Write

I am a student.
spanish:
A / An

Usa an cuando la siguiente palabra comience con a, e, i, o o u.


Ves

Soy a / an adulto.


Escribes

Soy an adulto.

Usa a cuando la siguiente palabra comience con cualquier otra letra.


Ves

Soy a / an estudiante.


Escribes

Soy a estudiante.

english:
Using a, an, and the

Use an when a thing starts with a, e, i, o, or u.

Use a when a thing starts with any other letter.

Do not put a, an, or the before a single describing word.


Examples

It is an apple.

You are a good friend.

He is happy.
spanish:
Uso de a, an y the

Utiliza an cuando una cosa comienza con a, e, i, o, u.

Utiliza a cuando una cosa comienza con cualquier otra letra.

No coloques a, an o the antes de un solo adjetivo.


Ejemplos

Es an apple.

Eres a good friend.

Él es happy.

english:
A, An with Describing Words

Do not put a, an, or the before a single describing word.


You See

He is happy / a happy.


You Write

He is happy.
spanish:
A, An con palabras descriptivas

No coloques a, an o the antes de una palabra descriptiva singular.


Ves

Él es happy / a happy.


Escribes

Él es happy.

english:
Come, Eat, and Drink

The past tense of come is came.

I come home yesterday. -> I came home yesterday.


The past tense of eat is ate.

She eats cereal earlier. -> She ate cereal earlier.


The past tense of drink is drank.

He drinks coffee this morning. -> He drank coffee this morning.
spanish:
Ven, Come y Bebe

El tiempo pasado de come es came.

Yo come a casa ayer. -> Yo came a casa ayer.


El tiempo pasado de eat es ate.

Ella eats cereal antes. -> Ella ate cereal antes.


El tiempo pasado de drink es drank.

Él drinks café esta mañana. -> Él drank café esta mañana.

english:
A, An with Things and Describing Words

Use an when a thing starts with a, e, i, o, or u.
Use a when a thing starts with any other letter.


Do not put a, an, or the before a single describing word.


You See
It is a / an apple.


You Write
It is an apple.


You See

He is happy / a happy.


You Write

He is happy.
spanish:
A, An con Cosas y Palabras Descriptivas

Usa an cuando una cosa comienza con a, e, i, o, u.
Usa a cuando una cosa comienza con cualquier otra letra.


No coloques a, an o the antes de una sola palabra descriptiva.


Ves
Es a / an apple.


Escribes
Es an apple.


Ves

Él es happy / a happy.


Escribes

Él es happy.

english:
A, An with Things and Describing Words

Use an when a thing starts with a, e, i, o, or u.

Use a when a thing starts with any other letter.


You See

It is a / an apple.


You Write

It is an apple.


Do not put a, an, or the before a single describing word.


You See

He is happy / a happy.


You Write

He is happy.
spanish:
A, An con Cosas y Palabras Descriptivas

Usa an cuando una cosa comienza con a, e, i, o, u.

Usa a cuando una cosa comienza con cualquier otra letra.


Tú Ves

Es a / an apple.


Tú Escribe

Es an apple.


No coloques a, an, o the antes de una palabra descriptiva sola.


Tú Ves

Él es happy / a happy.


Tú Escribe

Él es happy.

english:
Have, Do, and Go

The past tense of have is had.

I have a meeting yesterday. -> I had a meeting yesterday.


The past tense of do is did.

Do you go to the store earlier? -> Did you go to the store earlier?


The past tense of go is went.

She goes to the beach last week -> She went to the beach last week.
spanish:
Have, Do, y Go

El tiempo pasado de have es had.

Yo have una reunión ayer. -> Yo had una reunión ayer.


El tiempo pasado de do es did.

Do tú vas a la tienda antes? -> Did tú vas a la tienda antes?


El tiempo pasado de go es went.

Ella goes a la playa la semana pasada -> Ella went a la playa la semana pasada.

english:
A / An

Put a or an before a person or thing.


You See

Is she teacher / a teacher?


You Write

Is she a teacher?
spanish:
A / An

Coloca a o an antes de una persona o cosa.


Ves

¿Es ella teacher / a teacher?


Escribes

¿Es ella a teacher?

english:
The Before People and Things

When you start a sentence with a thing, always put the before the thing.


You See

House / The house is blue.


You Write

The house is blue.
spanish:
The antes de personas y cosas

Cuando comiences una oración con una cosa, siempre coloca the antes de la cosa.


Ves

House / The house es azul.


Escribes

The house es azul.

english:
The Before People and Things

When you start a sentence with a thing, always put the before the thing.


You See

House / The house is blue.


You Write

The house is blue.
spanish:
The Antes de Personas y Cosas

Cuando comiences una oración con una cosa, siempre coloca the antes de la cosa.


Ves

House / The house es azul.


Escribes

The house es azul.

english:
Say, Tell, Talk, and Ask

Say, tell, talk, and ask are similar, but they are used in different situations.


You can say something to somebody.

You can tell somebody something.

You can talk to somebody.

You can ask somebody a question.


You See

Did you just ___ to your mom?


You Write

Did you just talk to your mom?
spanish:
Decir, Contar, Hablar y Preguntar

Say, tell, talk y ask son similares, pero se utilizan en situaciones diferentes.


Puedes say algo a alguien.

Puedes tell algo a alguien.

Puedes talk con alguien.

Puedes ask una pregunta a alguien.


You See

¿Acabas de ___ a tu mamá?


You Write

¿Acabas de talk con tu mamá?

english:
Combining Sentences

When two sentences talk about the same person, you can combine them into one sentence. Use and to connect the two things about the person.


When there is only one of each thing, put a or an before both things.


You See

She is a mother.

She is a doctor.


You Write

She is a mother and a doctor.
spanish:
Combinar Oraciones

Cuando dos oraciones hablan sobre la misma persona, puedes combinarlas en una sola oración. Usa and para conectar las dos cosas sobre la persona.


Cuando hay solo una de cada cosa, pon a o an antes de ambas cosas.


Tú Ves

Ella es madre.

Ella es doctora.


Tú Escribe

Ella es madre y doctora.

english:
Say, Tell, Talk, and Ask

Say, tell, talk, and ask are similar, but they are used in different situations.


You can say something to somebody.

You can tell somebody something.

You can talk to somebody.

You can ask somebody a question.


You See

Did you just ___ to your mom?


You Write

Did you just talk to your mom?
spanish:
Decir, Contar, Hablar y Preguntar

Say, tell, talk y ask son similares, pero se utilizan en situaciones diferentes.


Puedes say algo a alguien.

Puedes tell algo a alguien.

Puedes talk con alguien.

Puedes ask una pregunta a alguien.


Tú Ves

¿Acabas de ___ a tu mamá?


Tú Escribes

¿Acabas de talk a tu mamá?

english:
Come, Eat, and Drink

The past tense of come is came.
I come home yesterday. -> I came home yesterday.

The past tense of eat is ate.
She eats cereal earlier. -> She ate cereal earlier.


The past tense of drink is drank.
He drinks coffee this morning. -> He drank coffee this morning.
spanish:
Ven, Come y Bebe

El tiempo pasado de come es came.
Yo come a casa ayer. -> Yo came a casa ayer.

El tiempo pasado de eat es ate.
Ella eats cereal más temprano. -> Ella ate cereal más temprano.


El tiempo pasado de drink es drank.
Él drinks café esta mañana. -> Él drank café esta mañana.

english:
Take, Give, and Get

The past tense of take is took.

I take a test yesterday. -> I took a test yesterday.


The past tense of give is gave.

She gives him a present earlier. -> She gave him a present earlier.


The past tense of get is got.

They all get candy for Halloween. -> They all got candy for Halloween.
spanish:
Take, Give, and Get

El pasado de take es took.

Yo take un examen ayer. -> Yo took un examen ayer.


El pasado de give es gave.

Ella gives un regalo antes. -> Ella gave un regalo antes.


El pasado de get es got.

Ellos todos get dulces para Halloween. -> Ellos todos got dulces para Halloween.

english:
Using Can

To ask a question with can, put can first, the person second, and the action word third.


You See

___ ___ ___ peanuts?


You Write

Can she eat peanuts?
spanish:
Usando Can

Para hacer una pregunta con can, coloca can primero, la persona en segundo lugar y la palabra de acción en tercero.


Tú Ves

___ ___ ___ peanuts?


Tú Escribe

Can she eat peanuts?

english:
To Be

Be is an action word. When you use be after a person or thing, you have to change be to am, are, or is.


I am
You are
He is
She is
It is
We are
They are


You See
I ___ a kind teacher.


You Write
I am a kind teacher.
spanish:
Ser

Be es un verbo de acción. Cuando usas be después de una persona o cosa, debes cambiar be por am, are o is.


Yo am
Tú are
Él is
Ella is
Eso is
Nosotros are
Ellos are


Tú Ves
Yo ___ un profesor amable.


Tú Escribes
Yo am un profesor amable.

english:
Take, Give, and Get

The past tense of take is took.

I take a test yesterday. -> I took a test yesterday.


The past tense of give is gave.

She gives him a present earlier. -> She gave him a present earlier.


The past tense of get is got.

They all get candy for Halloween. -> They all got candy for Halloween.
spanish:
Take, Give, and Get

El tiempo pasado de take es took.

Yo take un examen ayer. -> Yo took un examen ayer.


El tiempo pasado de give es gave.

Ella gives a él un regalo antes. -> Ella gave a él un regalo antes.


El tiempo pasado de get es got.

Todos ellos get dulces para Halloween. -> Todos ellos got dulces para Halloween.

english:
Action Phrase Meanings

All action phrases have different meanings, and sometimes the meanings are unexpected.


You See

I will pick her up / put her away / back her up from the airport later?


You Write

I will pick her up from the airport later?
spanish:
Significados de Frases de Acción

Todas las frases de acción tienen diferentes significados, y a veces los significados son inesperados.


Tú Ves

Voy a recogerla / guardarla / respaldarla del aeropuerto más tarde?


Tú Escribe

Voy a recogerla del aeropuerto más tarde?

english:
Action Phrase Meanings

All action phrases have different meanings, and sometimes the meanings are unexpected.


You See

I will pick her up / put her away / back her up from the airport later?


You Write

I will pick her up from the airport later?
spanish:
Significados de Frases de Acción

Todas las frases de acción tienen diferentes significados, y a veces los significados son inesperados.


Tú Ves

Yo pick her up / put her away / back her up del aeropuerto más tarde?


Tú Escribe

Yo pick her up del aeropuerto más tarde?

english:
Describing Things and Actions With Phrases

Give more information about a thing or action with phrases that start with words like in, at, on, to, behind, about, toward, down, and after.


Put the phrase right after the thing or action it’s describing. Do not use a comma.


You See

Julie baked bread ___ the oven.


You Write

Julie baked bread in the oven.
spanish:
Describiendo cosas y acciones con frases

Proporciona más información sobre una cosa o acción con frases que comienzan con palabras como in, at, on, to, behind, about, toward, down, y after.


Coloca la frase justo después de la cosa o acción que está describiendo. No uses coma.


Tú Ves

Julie horneó pan ___ el horno.


Tú Escribe

Julie horneó pan in el horno.

english:
Describing Things and Actions With Phrases

Give more information about a thing or action with phrases that start with words like in, at, on, to, behind, about, toward, down, and after.


Put the phrase right after the thing or action it’s describing. Do not use a comma.


You See

Julie baked bread ___ the oven.


You Write

Julie baked bread in the oven.
spanish:
Describiendo Cosas y Acciones con Frases

Brinda más información sobre una cosa o acción con frases que comienzan con palabras como in, at, on, to, behind, about, toward, down, y after.


Coloca la frase justo después de la cosa o acción que está describiendo. No uses coma.


Tú Ves

Julie horneó pan ___ el horno.


Tú Escribe

Julie horneó pan en el horno.

english:
Say, Tell, and Hear

The past tense of say is said.

I say I wanted tacos for dinner. -> I said I wanted tacos for dinner.


The past tense of tell is told.

She tells her mom something earlier. -> She told her mom something earlier.


The past tense of hear is heard.

He hears Kyle singing this morning. -> He heard Kyle singing this morning.
spanish:
Say, Tell, and Hear

El pasado de say es said.

Yo say que quería tacos para cenar. -> Yo said que quería tacos para cenar.


El pasado de tell es told.

Ella tells algo a su mamá más temprano. -> Ella told algo a su mamá más temprano.


El pasado de hear es heard.

Él hears a Kyle cantar esta mañana. -> Él heard a Kyle cantar esta mañana.

english:
Combining Sentences

When two sentences talk about the same person, you can combine them into one sentence. Use and to connect the two things about the person.


When there is only one of each thing, put a or an before both things.


You See

She has a dog.

She has a cat.


You Write

She has a dog and a cat.
spanish:
Combinando Oraciones

Cuando dos oraciones hablan sobre la misma persona, puedes combinarlas en una sola oración. Usa and para conectar las dos cosas sobre la persona.


Cuando solo hay uno de cada cosa, coloca a o an antes de ambas cosas.


You See

She has a dog.

She has a cat.


You Write

She has a dog and a cat.

english:
Combining Sentences

When two sentences talk about the same person, you can combine them into one sentence. Use and to connect the two things about the person.

When there is only one of each thing, put a or an before both things.


You See

She wants a brown dog.

She wants an orange cat.


You Write

She wants a brown dog and an orange cat.
spanish:
Combinando Oraciones

Cuando dos oraciones hablan sobre la misma persona, puedes combinarlas en una sola oración. Usa and para conectar las dos cosas sobre la persona.

Cuando hay solo una de cada cosa, pon a o an antes de ambas cosas.


You See

She wants a brown dog.

She wants an orange cat.


You Write

She wants a brown dog and an orange cat.

Examples:

You See

You Write

Usa estas palabras en diferentes situaciones:

A, An con Palabras Descriptivas

When a sentence starts with a person or a thing, put the before the person or thing.


You See

Car is red.

(the)


You Write

The car is red.

Cuando una oración comienza con una persona o una cosa, coloca the antes de la persona o cosa.

(the)


Escribes

She is a doctor.


You Write

She is a mother and a doctor.

Use the before specific things or things that have already been mentioned.

Uso de a, an y the

Usa a o an antes de cosas generales o cosas que no se han visto o mencionado antes.

english:
Combining Sentences

When there is only one of each thing, put a or an before both things.


You See

She wants a brown dog.

She wants an orange cat.


You Write

She wants a brown dog and an orange cat.
spanish:
Combinación de oraciones

Cuando dos oraciones hablan sobre la misma persona, puedes combinarlas en una sola oración. Usa and para conectar las dos cosas sobre la persona.


Cuando solo hay uno de cada cosa, coloca a o an antes de ambas cosas.

Ella quiere un gato naranja.


You Write

Ella quiere a perro marrón and an gato naranja.

english:
Combining Describing Sentences

When two sentences describe the same person, you can combine them into one sentence. Use and to connect the describing words.


You See

She is kind.

She is happy.


You Write

She is kind and happy.

Combinando oraciones descriptivas

Cuando dos oraciones describen a la misma persona, puedes combinarlas en una sola oración. Usa and para conectar las palabras descriptivas.


Ves

Ella es amable.

Ella está feliz.


Escribes

english:
In, At, On

Use these words in different situations:


Things go on a surface.

Things go in a container or room.

Things are at a place.


It is on the table.

It is in the box.

It is at the park.


You See

My backpack is ___ school.


You Write

My backpack is at school.
spanish:
In, At, On

Usa estas palabras en diferentes situaciones:


Las cosas van on una superficie.

Las cosas van in un contenedor o habitación.

Las cosas están at un lugar.


Está on la mesa.

Está in la caja.

Está at el parque.


Tú Ves

Mi mochila está ___ la escuela.


Tú Escribes

Mi mochila está at la escuela.

english:
Drive, Swim, and Run

The past tense of drive is drove.

I drive home yesterday. -> I drove home yesterday.


The past tense of swim is swam.

She swim in the pool earlier. -> She swam in the pool earlier.


The past tense of run is ran.

He runs this morning. -> He ran this morning.
spanish:
Conducir, Nadar y Correr

El tiempo pasado de drive es drove.

Yo drive a casa ayer. -> Yo drove a casa ayer.


El tiempo pasado de swim es swam.

Ella swim en la piscina más temprano. -> Ella swam en la piscina más temprano.


El tiempo pasado de run es ran.

Él runs esta mañana. -> Él ran esta mañana.

english:
Drive, Swim, and Run

The past tense of drive is drove.

I drive home yesterday. -> I drove home yesterday.


The past tense of swim is swam.

She swim in the pool earlier. -> She swam in the pool earlier.


The past tense of run is ran.

He runs this morning. -> He ran this morning.
spanish:
Conducir, Nadar y Correr

El pasado de drive es drove.

Yo drive a casa ayer. -> Yo drove a casa ayer.


El pasado de swim es swam.

Ella swim en la piscina más temprano. -> Ella swam en la piscina más temprano.


El pasado de run es ran.

Él runs esta mañana. -> Él ran esta mañana.

english:
Have, Do, and Go

The past tense of have is had.

I have a meeting yesterday. -> I had a meeting yesterday.


The past tense of do is did.

Do you go to the store earlier? -> Did you go to the store earlier?


The past tense of go is went.

She goes to the beach last week -> She went to the beach last week.
spanish:
Have, Do, y Go

El tiempo pasado de have es had.

Yo have una reunión ayer. -> Yo had una reunión ayer.


El tiempo pasado de do es did.

Do vas a la tienda más temprano? -> Did vas a la tienda más temprano?


El tiempo pasado de go es went.

Ella goes a la playa la semana pasada -> Ella went a la playa la semana pasada.

english:
Say, Tell, and Hear

The past tense of say is said.

I say I wanted tacos for dinner. -> I said I wanted tacos for dinner.


The past tense of tell is told.

She tells her mom something earlier. -> She told her mom something earlier.


The past tense of hear is heard.

He hears Kyle singing this morning. -> He heard Kyle singing this morning.
spanish:
Say, Tell, and Hear

El tiempo pasado de say es said.

Yo say que quería tacos para cenar. -> Yo said que quería tacos para cenar.


El tiempo pasado de tell es told.

Ella tells algo a su mamá antes. -> Ella told algo a su mamá antes.


El tiempo pasado de hear es heard.

Él hears a Kyle cantando esta mañana. -> Él heard a Kyle cantando esta mañana.

english:
In, At, On

Use these words in different situations:


Things go on a surface.

Things go in a container or room.

Things are at a place.


It is on the table.

It is in the box.

It is at the park.


You See

My backpack is ___ school.


You Write

My backpack is at school.
spanish:
In, At, On

Usa estas palabras en diferentes situaciones:


Las cosas van on una superficie.

Las cosas van in un contenedor o habitación.

Las cosas están at un lugar.


Está on la mesa.

Está in la caja.

Está at el parque.


You See

Mi mochila está ___ escuela.


You Write

Mi mochila está at escuela.

english:
Using Can

To ask a question with can, put can first, the person second, and the action word third.


You See

___ ___ ___ peanuts?


You Write

Can she eat peanuts?
spanish:
Usando Can

Para hacer una pregunta con can, coloca can primero, la persona segundo y la palabra de acción tercero.


Tú Ves

___ ___ ___ peanuts?


Tú Escribe

Can she eat peanuts?

english:
Using a, an, and the

Use a or an before general things or things that have not been seen or talked about before.


Use the before specific things or things that have already been mentioned.
spanish:
Uso de a, an y the

Usa a o an antes de cosas generales o cosas que no se han visto o mencionado antes.


Usa the antes de cosas específicas o cosas que ya han sido mencionadas.
